intro: Maytenus vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis mayten, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Fiji and Tonga. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and wind-prone environments.
